title: Supergravity without gravity and its BV formulation
authors: Julian Kupka, Charles Strickland-Constable, Fridrich Valach
abstract:
The generalised-geometric formulation of 10-dimensional supergravity suggests
a particular simple "limit", which results in a theory whose only dynamical
degrees of freedom are the dilaton and the dilatino. The theory is still
invariant both under generalised diffeomorphisms and a local supersymmetry and
in many aspects is structurally similar to the original supergravity, which
makes it a convenient playground for understanding more subtle aspects of the
full physical setup. In particular, the simplicity and the geometric nature of
the dilatonic theory allow us to build a full BV extension to all orders in the
fermionic variables.
